Summary •Physician scientist with extensive experience in the investigation of primary immune deficiency. Identified DOCK8 as the cause of autosomal recessive hyper-IgE syndrome.  
 
•Well-versed in microarray processing and analysis, including expression, genotyping and copy number arrays. Strong understanding of bioinformatics, R programming and SQL databases. 
 
•Involved in the development of universal newborn screening for severe combined immune deficiency from its earliest stages, including cost-effectiveness analysis, test development, and follow-up planning. The screening program is now recommended by the US Department of Health and Human Services. 
 
•Director of the Stanford Immunology and Allergy Training Program

Summary I am passionate about helping others and improving systems through better design. 
 
I have been in solo practice in the heart of San Francisco since 2005. My direct patient care, teaching of medical students and residents, along with my humanitarian work globally, led me to develop Drip Drop, a next generation oral rehydration solution (ORS). 
 
One of my goals is to increase the awareness of the proven efficacy and safety of oral rehydration therapy (ORT). 
 
This, along with caring for my patients, are my life's passions. Summary I am passionate about helping others and improving systems through better design.

I have been in solo practice in the heart of San Francisco since 2005. My direct patient care, teaching of medical students and residents, along with my humanitarian work globally, led me to develop Drip Drop, a next generation oral rehydration solution (ORS). 
 
One of my goals is to increase the awareness of the proven efficacy and safety of oral rehydration therapy (ORT). 
 
This, along with caring for my patients, are my life's passions. Experience Founder and Chief Medical Officer DripDrop January 2008  – Present (7 years 8 months) San Francisco Bay Area Drip Drop ORS is an advanced oral rehydration solution.  
 
I founded Drip Drop because, as a doctor, I was frustrated with the fact that I could not offer my patients a medically credible hydration product that tasted good.  
 
Since 2008, Drip Drop has been used domestically and internationally to treat dehydration in a variety of settings and conditions; from disaster relief, post-operative patients, and emergency departments to patients with chronic dehydration concerns, such as Short Gut Syndrome and head and neck cancer patients. Drip Drop advances one of the most important medical technologies of the 20th Century--oral rehydration therapy (ORT)-- by improving the taste, which has been a major barrier to patient compliance.  
 
Drip Drop's vision is to improve health, save lives, reduce healthcare costs. Founder Dolhun Clinic June 2005  – Present (10 years 3 months) 2100 Webster Street, Suite 302, San Francisco, CA 94115 The Dolhun Clinic is a state-of-the-art medical practice that focuses on patient-centered medicine. We are a low-volume and high-touch medical practice located in the heart of San Francisco. Our goal is to achieve the best possible health care outcomes by forming long-lasting relationships with our patients. Resident Advisor for 3 years Honors & Awards First SDMPH Highlighted Member Society for Disaster Medicine and Public Health January 2014 Dr. Eduardo Dolhun, Adjunct Assistant Clinical Professor at the Stanford University Medical Center and member of the Society of Disaster Medicine and Public Health, went to Tacloban City, Philippines, the epicenter of an area devastated by Typhoon Haiyan which left an estimated 10,000 people dead. 
Dolhun travled to the Philippines as an innovator, doctor, and humanitarian. During his time the Philippines, Dr. Dolhun saw first-hand the need for a fast, inexpensive way to stay hydrated. Months after the disaster, the city’s water and sewage infrastructure remained, in some cases, damaged and others, completely inoperable. Experts have identified a high risk of further casualties from cholera, norovirus, rotovirus or other diseases that can lead to acute diarrhea and dehydration. 
 
Dr. Dolhun is not a novice to the threat of dehydration. Previously, Dr. Dolhun witnessed thousands of people dying unnecessarily from dehydration while on a relief mission in Guatemala. In response, he created a Drip Drop, a rehydration therapy that would meet the medical standards of rehydration therapy as well as have a palatable taste. Dr. Dolhun claims that Drip Drop is a precise formula that combines sodium, potassium, magnesium and glucose that is absorbed faster in the human body and tastes better. The criterion is outstanding service to the community beyond Marquette University.

Summary I hope to compassionately and effectively promote health and well being through better understanding of the interaction between environmental, biological and psychological factors influencing decision making and self regulation. Complex behavioral problems can be viewed through the lens of the basic sciences, including the psychological sciences of decision theory and motivation, recently organized under a framework described as behavioral economics. I have been employing conceptual models and interventions derived from decision theory, the motivation literature and especially a unique model from behavioral economics known as the Intertemporal Bargaining Model to diverse, important problems in my clinical, educational and research efforts. I have applied this framework in efforts ranging from the promotion of healthy levels of physical activity, healthy body weight / composition, better quality sleep, healthy emotion regulation, improved mentoring and parenting practices, improved community preparedness and disaster response, as well as in promoting more effective clinical decision making, evidence based practices and well‐being in physicians. I hope through these efforts to better empower individuals, mentors and those who influence our shared environment (self, parents, teachers, doctors, work supervisors, government officials etc…) with effective strategies for the promotion of wise, value concordant, autonomous decision making associated with good long term quality of life and healthful outcomes.
